title: VA--School Bus Crash-Williamsburg
headline: 8 children suffer minor injuries in a school bus accident, school official says
headline_extended: Eight children have suffered minor injuries in a school bus accident that occurred in the Williamsburg-James City County school district
description_summary: Eight children have suffered minor injuries in a school bus accident that occurred in the Williamsburg-James City County school district. Kara Wall is a spokeswoman for the school system. She says the bus was carrying about 30 students from James Blair Middle School when the accident occurred Friday morning. The bus was in a minor accident with one other vehicle. Eight students reported minor injuries and were evaluated at the scene. The students were then taken to a local hospital for evaluation out of an abundance of caution.

keywords: school bus accident Williamsburg James City County Virginia
body_nitf:
WILLIAMSBURG, Va. (AP) — Eight children suffered minor injuries during a school bus accident in Virginia on Friday morning, officials said.

The school bus was carrying about 30 students from James Blair Middle School in the Williamsburg-James City County school system, spokeswoman Kara Wall said in a statement.

The bus was involved in a minor accident with one other vehicle, Wall said. Eight students had reported minor injuries and were evaluated at the scene. Following a request from parents and out of an abundance of caution, those students were taken to a local hospital for evaluation.

Health.reason: The document describes a school bus accident where eight children suffered minor injuries and were taken to a hospital for evaluation. While the document does touch on health-related aspects, such as the injuries and medical evaluations, the primary focus is on the accident itself rather than health as a broader topic. Therefore, it is somewhat relevant but not highly focused on health.
